metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35452 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.46 A specially crafted Digest nonce can cause a stack overflow in mod_auth_digest. There is no report of this overflow being exploitable, nor the Apache HTTP Server team could create one, though some particular compiler and/or compilation option might make it possible, with limited consequences anyway due to the size (a single byte) and the value (zero byte) of the overflow

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
